menu3.RangeMx: 0: Not Encrypted|1:Encrypted
41:Sensor Rest|42:Sensor Motion|11:Ignition Off Rest|12:Ignition On Motion|21:Ignition On Rest|22:Ignition On Motion|1A:Fake Tow|16:Tow|
0:Stop Charging|1:Charging
0:Unknow|1:Inserted|2:Removed|3:Ready|4:Locked Pin|5:Locked PUK|
0: No Searching|1: Registered|2: Searching|3: Denied|4: Unknown|5: Roaming|
0: No Searching|1: Registered|2: Searching|3: Denied|4: Unknown|5: Roaming|6: Only Local SMS|7: Only Roaming SMS|8: Registration of Emergency Services|
0: Deactivated|1: Activating|2: Activated|3: Deactivating|
0: Initial|1: No Service|2: Idle|3: Activating|4: Connecting|5: Sending|6: Reset|
0: Closed|1: Opened|
0: Connected|1: Disconnected|3: Unknown|
0: GPGSV|1: GLGSV|2: BDGSV|3:GAGSV|

Ignition detection|Digital input 1|Digital input 2|Digital input 3|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Digital input 9|Digital input A|Digital input B|Digital input C|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|

Digital output 1|Digital output 2|Digital output 3|Digital output 4|Digital output 5|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Digital output 9|Digital output A|Digital output B|Digital output C|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|
0: Read|1: Send|
0: Normal IO|1: Function IO|2: Interrupt IO|
0: Input|1: Output|
0: Low level|1: High Level|
0: Disable Pull|1: Enable Pull|
0: Pull Down|1: Pull Up|
0: Disable BLE Chip|1: Enable BLE Chip|
0: BG22C224|1: BLUENRG345|

menu2.name: BSI (Bearer Settings Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTBSI is used to configure the parameters for GSM/GPRS/LTE Cat1 data connection.

menu3.Description: Access point name (APN).
The GPRS APN user name.
The GPRS APN password.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Auto (LTE & GSM)|1: GSM Only|3: LTE Only|
menu3.Description: Note: “GSM” means EGPRS here.

menu2.name: SRI (Server Settings Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTSRI is used to configure how to report all the messages, including the server information and the method of communication between the backend server and the terminal. If the terminal is configured correctly, it should be able to report data to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Stop mode|1: TCP short-connection preferred mode|2: TCP short-connection forced mode|3: TCP long-connection mode|4: UDP mode|5: Forced SMS mode|6: UDP with fixed local port mode|7: Backup server supported TCP long-connection mode|9: MQTT mode|
menu3.Description: This parameter defines the communication method between the backend server and the terminal.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Low priority |2: High priority|5: Timestamp priority|
menu3.Description: The working mode the buffer report function.
The IP address or the domain name of the primary server.
The port of the primary server.
The IP address or the domain name of the backup server.
The port of the backup server.
Maximum 20 characters including the optional national code starting with “+” for sending SMS messages.
The interval of sending heartbeat package message which makes GPRS connection alive.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable SACK And Check|2: Enable SACK But Not check|
menu3.Description: This parameter defines whether the backend server should respond to the terminal with the SACK messages when receiving messages from the terminal.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: ASCII|1: HEX|
menu3.Description: This parameter defines the format of the report message sent from the device to the backend server.
0: The device will send the ACK confirmation using the mode specified by <Report Mode>|1: The device will send the ACK confirmation via SMS to the phone number from which the command is sent via SMS|
Bitwise mask to configure the messages which should be sent at high priority when the <Buffer Mode> is 5.
A numeral to indicate the time to maintain TCP connection for receiving commands from the server.
Primary DNS server address.
Secondary DNS server.

menu2.name: QSS (Quick Start Settings)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTQSS is used to configure GPRS and backend server parameters if the length of all the settings is less than 160 bytes. Otherwise, the two commands AT+GTBSI and AT+GTSRI are used to set those parameters.

menu3.Description: Access point name (APN).
The GPRS APN user name.
The GPRS APN password.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Stop mode|1: TCP short-connection preferred mode|2: TCP short-connection forced mode|3: TCP long-connection mode|4: UDP mode|5: Forced SMS mode|6: UDP with fixed local port mode|7: Backup server supported TCP long-connection mode|9: MQTT mode|
menu3.Description: This parameter defines the communication method between the backend server and the terminal.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Low priority |2: High priority|5: Timestamp priority|
menu3.Description: The working mode the buffer report function.
The IP address or the domain name of the primary server.
The port of the primary server.
The IP address or the domain name of the backup server.
The port of the backup server.
Maximum 20 characters including the optional national code starting with “+” for sending SMS messages.
The interval of sending heartbeat package message which makes GPRS connection alive.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable SACK And Check|2: Enable SACK But Not check|
menu3.Description: This parameter defines whether the backend server should respond to the terminal with the SACK messages when receiving messages from the terminal.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: ASCII|1: HEX|
menu3.Description: This parameter defines the format of the report message sent from the device to the backend server.
0: The device will send the ACK confirmation using the mode specified by <Report Mode>|1: The device will send the ACK confirmation via SMS to the phone number from which the command is sent via SMS|
Bitwise mask to configure the messages which should be sent at high priority when the <Buffer Mode> is 5.

menu2.name: MQT ( Mqtt Server)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTMQT is used to configure the username and password to connect to the MQTT server and to subscribe to topics and publish topics, If the terminal is configured correctly, it should be able to report data to the MQTT server.

menu3.Description: It is used to set keep alive mechanism for MQTT.
If the MQTT server uses authentication, the user name is specified here.
If the MQTT server uses authentication, the password is specified here.
The client subscribes to topic name.
The client publishes topic name.
Each client connecting to the server has a unique client identifier (ClientID).

menu2.name: MSI (Multi Server)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTMSI is used to configure where and how to report all the messages, including the server information and the communication method between the backend server and the terminal. When the terminal is configured correctly, it should be able to report data to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 2:The Data Server of MSI
menu3.Description: The index of the Multi Server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Stop mode|2:TCP short-connection forced mode|3:TCP long-connection mode|4:UDP mode|6:UDP with fixed local port|
menu3.Description: This parameter defines the communication method between the backend server and the terminal.
The IP address or the domain name of the primary server.
The port of the primary server.
The interval of sending heartbeat package message which makes GPRS connection alive.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Disable|1:Enable SACK And Check|2:Enable SACK But Not check|
menu3.Description: This parameter defines whether the backend server should respond to the terminal with the SACK messages when receiving messages from the terminal.
A numeral to indicate the time to maintain TCP connection for receiving commands from the server.

menu2.name: TLS (TLS Data Encryption)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTTLS is used to configure TLS encryption parameters.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The Data Server of SRI|
menu3.Description: The index of the Server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Specify whether the terminal enables the TLS function.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Do not verify the certificates|1: Only server certification|2: Two-way certification
menu3.Description: Specify the certificate verification method for the terminal.

menu2.name: CFG (Global Configuration)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTCFG command is used to configure global parameters.

menu3.Description: It is set to change the current password.
An ASCII string which represents the name of the device.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable the odograph by GNSS|
menu3.Description: Enable/disable the odograph function to calculate the total mileage.
The initial value for calculating the total mileage.

menu3.RangeMx: Speed|Azimuth|Altitude|Cells Information|Mileage|Send Time|Device Name|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to configure the composition of a report message, especially the composition of GNSS information.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: GNSS Deep Saving Mode|2: GNSS Low Saving Mode|
menu3.Description: It configures the power saving function of the device.

menu3.RangeMx: GNSS Satellite Number|Reserved|
menu3.Description: A bitwise numeral to control whether to include the corresponding fields in each position after <Cell ID>.
Bitwise mask to configure which event report will be sent to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Each time the device is powered on, all the LEDs will work for 30 minutes and then turn off.|1:All the LEDs turn on as configured.|3:Each time the device is connected to or disconnected from the vehicle, or the engine ignition status has changed, all the LEDs will work for 5 minutes and then turn off.|4:Each time the device is connected to the vehicle, all the LEDs will work for 5 minutes and then turn off.|5:All the LEDs will stay off all the time.|
menu3.Description: It configures the working mode of all LEDs.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu3.Description: The interval for reporting the device information.

menu3.RangeMx: 00: Ignore SMS location request.|10: Report the current location (+RESP:GTLBC) to the server.|20: Send current location with Google map link to Caller ID via SMS.|
0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: It configures whether to enable backup battery.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Charge On Need|1: Charge After Ignition On|
menu3.Description: It controls the charge mode of the backup battery.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate whether to enable AGPS.

menu3.RangeMx: 00: Do not allow the cell information report.|40: Allow the cell information report after failing to get GNSS position if cell information is available.|80: Report the message +RESP:GTGSM after getting GNSS position successfully every time if cell information is available.|C0: Report the message +RESP:GTGSM no matter whether it is successful to get GNSS position if cell information is available.|&+RESP:GTRTL|+RESP:GTLBC|+RESP:GTFRI/GTERI|Reserved|+RESP:GTTOW|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|

menu3.Description: A time parameter to monitor the GNSS signal.

menu2.name: DOG (Protocol Watchdog)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTDOG command is used to reboot the device in a time based manner or upon ignition. This helps the device avoid working in an abnormal state for a long time. Besides these two automatic reboot methods, the device also supports the use of the digital input to trigger the reboot manually.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Reboot Periodically|2: Ignition Reboot|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the watchdog function.

If the time interval between the current ignition-on and last ignition-on reboot is greater than the value specified by this parameter when the working mode is 2, the device will automatically reboot upon ignition on.
The time interval for rebooting the device. It is measured in days.
The time to perform the reboot operation when the <Interval> condition is met.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Whether to report the message +RESP:GTDOG before reboot.
The interval for rebooting the device when there is no network signal. 0 means “Do not reboot the device”.
The interval for rebooting the device when the device is unable to be registered to the EGPRS/LTE network. 0 means “Do not reboot the device”.
The length of time (in minutes) before rebooting the device when the device fails to send a message. 0 means “Do not reboot the device”.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Reboot System|1: Reboot RF Module|
menu3.Description: It is used to set the category that needs to be rebooted.

menu2.name: GAM (GNSS-Assisted Motion)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTGAM is used for assisting in measuring motion with GNSS if the sensor detects stationary state while the vehicle is ignition on.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the GNSS-assisted motion measurement function.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Enable/disable the use of GNSS speed to assist in motion measurement based on motion sensor state.
The speed threshold which is combined with GNSS speed to measure the status of movement.
If the average speed is higher than <Motion Speed Threshold> for <Motion Cumulative Time>, the device is considered to be in moving state.
If the average speed is lower than <Motion Speed Threshold> for <Motionless Cumulative Time>, the device is considered to be in stationary state.
If GNSS takes longer than <GNSS Fix Failure Timeout> before it gets a fix, the device will update the motion status from the motion sensor.

menu2.name: HMC (Hour Meter Count)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTHMC is used to measure the accumulated use time of the device with each actuation of ignition on. To use this command, the ignition signal must be connected to the device.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Difference Calculation Mode|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable the hour meter count function.| 1: Difference Calculation Mode. The current <Hour Meter Count> reported in +RESP:GTFRI, +RESP:GTIGN and +RESP:GTIGF is equal to (=) <Hour Meter Count> + current <Initial Hour Meter Count> - last <Initial Hour Meter Count>.| 2: Initial Value Mode. The current <Hour Meter Count> reported in +RESP:GTFRI, +RESP:GTIGN or +RESP:GTIGF is the same as the value of <Initial Hour Meter Count>.
Initial hours meter count.

menu2.name: HRM (Hex Report Mask)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTHRM command consists of <+ACK Mask>, <+RSP Mask>, <+EVT Mask>, <+INF Mask>, <+HBD Mask> and <+DAT Mask> which control the composition of the corresponding HEX report message. In each HEX report message, the corresponding mask for the report indicates which part is reported.

menu3.RangeMx: Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Device Name|Send Time|Count Number|
menu3.Description: Component mask of the acknowledgement received.

menu3.RangeMx: Speed|Azimuth|Altitude|Cells Information|Send Time|Count Number|Device Name|Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Battery Level|External Power Voltage|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Motion Status|Satellite Information|Current Mileage|Total Mileage|Current Hour Meter Count|Total Hour Meter Count|
menu3.Description: Component mask of the location report message.

menu3.RangeMx: Speed|Azimuth|Altitude|Cells Information|Send Time|Count Number|Device Name|Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Battery Level|External Power Voltage|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Motion Status|Satellite Information|Current Mileage|Total Mileage|Current Hour Meter Count|Total Hour Meter Count|
menu3.Description: Component mask of the event report message.

menu3.RangeMx: |Length|Device Name|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Send Time|Count Number|INF Expansion Mask|+RESP:GTVER|Reserved|+RESP:GTGPS|+RESP:GTBAT|+RESP:GTCID|+RESP:GTCSQ|+RESP:GTTMZ|+RESP:GTGSM
menu3.Description: Component mask of the information report message.

menu3.RangeMx: |+RESP:GTGSV|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|+RESP:GTBTI|Reserved|Reserved|+RESP:GTSCS|Reserved|+RESP:GTRSV|INF Expansion2 Mask|
menu3.Description: Component mask of the information report message.

menu3.RangeMx: |Reserved|Reserved|+RESP:GTBSV|Reserved|<Network Type>|+RESP:GTASV|
menu3.Description: component mask of the expand information report.

menu3.RangeMx: |Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Device Name|Send Time|Count Number|UID
menu3.Description: Component mask of the heartbeat data.

menu3.RangeMx: |Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Device Name|Send Time|Count Number|
menu3.Description: Component mask of the data report message.

menu3.RangeMx: |Length|Device Name|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Send Time|Count Number
menu3.Description: Component mask of the crash data packet.

menu2.name: OWH (Outside Working Hours)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTOWH is used to define the working hours and the working mode to protect the privacy.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|3: Automatic Mode|
menu3.Description: The working mode of this function.
It specifies the working days in a week in a bitwise manner.
The first period of the start working hours in a day.
The first period of the end working hours in a day.
The second period of the start working hours in a day.
The second period of the end working hours in a day.

menu2.name: PDS (Preserving Device's States)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTPDS is used to preserve specified logic states for the device. The function works according to the <Mode> setting, and the logic state(s) to be saved are selected according to the value of <Mask>.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Save Logical States|2: Reset Logical States|
menu3.Description: The working mode of this function.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: States of GEO|1: Reserved|2: Reserved|3: Information of last known position|4: State of ignition|5: Reserved|6: Reserved|7: State of SPD|8: State of SSR|9: State of main power|10: State of PEO|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to configure which device state(s) will be preserved. Each bit represents a state.

menu2.name: TMA (Time Adjustment)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTTMA is used to adjust for the local time of the device remotely. Upon receiving this command, the device will set the time zone and daylight saving accordingly. Then it will use the given UTC time to adjust for the local time based on the time zone and daylight saving setting.

menu3.Description: It indicates the positive or negative offset of the local time from UTC.
UTC offset in hours.
UTC offset in minutes.
Enable/disable daylight saving time.
UTC time used to adjust for the local time on the device.
A numeral to indicate whether to check GNSS UTC time with network time.

menu2.name: WLT (Allowlist)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTWLT is used to configure a list of authorized phone numbers which are allowed to perform the location by call and SMS functions.

menu3.RangeMx: Bit0: Reserved|Bit1: Reserved|Bit2: Allowlist for SMS|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to configure the white list.
The index range of the white list to which the phone numbers are to be updated.
The index range of the white list to which the phone numbers are to be updated.
A list of comma-separated phone numbers to be updated to the white list.

menu2.name: AVS (Accelerometer Virtual Ignition)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTAVS is used to configure parameters for detecting virtual ignition status based on motion status. It works when hard-wired ignition line is not connected and Accelerometer (motion status) virtual ignition mode is enabled by AT+GTVMS.

menu3.Description: A time parameter to determine whether the device enters stationary state.
A time parameter to determine whether the device enters moving state.

menu2.name: VVS (Voltage Virtual Ignition)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTVVS is used to configure parameters for checking ignition state by voltage. It will work when hard-wired ignition line is not connected and Voltage Virtual Ignition mode is enabled by AT+GTVMS.

menu3.Description: The external power voltage in ignition on state.
The offset from <Ignition On Voltage> used to determine ignition on or ignition off state.
The debounce time before updating virtual ignition on state according to the external power voltage. Unit: second.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Enable/disable smart voltage adjustment algorithm.
The debounce time to wait before updating the virtual ignition off state according to the external power voltage.

menu2.name: VMS (Virtual Ignition Mode Selection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTVMS is used to configure the mode of virtual ignition state detection.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|2: Voltage virtual ignition detection mode|4: Accelerometer virtual ignition detection mode|7: Combined detection mode|
menu3.Description: A numeral to define the working mode of detecting virtual ignition state.

menu3.RangeMx: Bit0 (01): Voltage virtual ignition detection|Bit1 (02): Motion status virtual ignition detection|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to detect the ignition on event.

menu3.RangeMx: Bit0 (01): Voltage virtual ignition detection|Bit1 (02): Motion status virtual ignition detection|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to detect ignition off event.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: AND logic.|1: OR logic.|
menu3.Description: The logic of each bit in <Virtual Ignition On Mask>.

menu2.name: CMD (Command String Storage)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTCMD command is used to store the commands which will be used by the command AT+GTUDF.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Delete command|1: Add command|
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate how to handle (add/delete) the stored command string.
A numeral to identify the stored command.
The whole content of the stored command.

menu2.name: UDF (User Defined Function)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTUDF command is used to bind input events and stored commands. The input events will trigger the corresponding stored commands.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable The Event Group|1: Enable The Event Group|2: Delete The Event Group|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the user defined function.
A numeral to identify the group of input events and the stored commands to be executed.

menu3.RangeMx: Power on finished|Ignition on|Ignition off|Attached to the GPRS network|Not attached to the GPRS network|Registered on GSM network|Not registered on GSM network|Network roaming|Network non-roaming|Reserved|GNSS is on|GNSS is off|The device is stationary|The device is moving|External charge inserted|No external charge|The device is charging|The device is not charging|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|SIM card is inserted|SIM card is not inserted|Reserved|Reserved|Inside the speed range|Outside the speed range|Messages need to be sent|No messages need to be sent|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Network jamming is detected|Network jamming is not detected|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|The device fixes GNSS successfully|The device fails to fix GNSS
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask which indicates the input events included in the group.
The debounce time for input events before the specified stored commands are executed.

menu3.RangeMx: Inside the Geo 0|Inside the Geo 1|Inside the Geo 2|Inside the Geo 3|Inside the Geo 4|Inside the Geo 5|Inside the Geo 6|Inside the Geo 7|Inside the Geo 8|Inside the Geo 9|Inside the Geo 10|Inside the Geo 11|Inside the Geo 12|Inside the Geo 13|Inside the Geo 14|Inside the Geo 15|Inside the Geo 16|Inside the Geo 17|Inside the Geo 18|Inside the Geo 19|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask used to indicate the input events which occur within the Geo-fence.

menu3.RangeMx: Outside the Geo 0|Outside the Geo 1|Outside the Geo 2|Outside the Geo 3|Outside the Geo 4|Outside the Geo 5|Outside the Geo 6|Outside the Geo 7|Outside the Geo 8|Outside the Geo 9|Outside the Geo 10|Outside the Geo 11|Outside the Geo 12|Outside the Geo 13|Outside the Geo 14|Outside the Geo 15|Outside the Geo 16|Outside the Geo 17|Outside the Geo 18|Outside the Geo 19|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to indicate the input events which occur outside the Geo-fence.

menu3.RangeMx: Stocmd ID Mask 0|Stocmd ID Mask 1|Stocmd ID Mask 2|Stocmd ID Mask 3|Stocmd ID Mask 4|Stocmd ID Mask 5|Stocmd ID Mask 6|Stocmd ID Mask 7|Stocmd ID Mask 8|Stocmd ID Mask 9|Stocmd ID Mask 10|Stocmd ID Mask 11|Stocmd ID Mask 12|Stocmd ID Mask 13|Stocmd ID Mask 14|Stocmd ID Mask 15|Stocmd ID Mask 16|Stocmd ID Mask 17|Stocmd ID Mask 18|Stocmd ID Mask 19|Stocmd ID Mask 20|Stocmd ID Mask 21|Stocmd ID Mask 22|Stocmd ID Mask 23|Stocmd ID Mask 24|Stocmd ID Mask 25|Stocmd ID Mask 26|Stocmd ID Mask 27|Stocmd ID Mask 28|Stocmd ID Mask 29|Stocmd ID Mask 30|Stocmd ID Mask 31|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask of the stored commands which will be executed after the status of the group becomes TRUE

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate whether to return an acknowledgement message after a stored command is executed.

menu3.RangeMx: Inside the Peo 0|Inside the Peo 1|Inside the Peo 2|Inside the Peo 3|Inside the Peo 4|Inside the Peo 5|Inside the Peo 6|Inside the Peo 7|Inside the Peo 8|Inside the Peo 9|Inside the Peo 10|Inside the Peo 11|Inside the Peo 12|Inside the Peo 13|Inside the Peo 14|Inside the Peo 15|Inside the Peo 16|Inside the Peo 17|Inside the Peo 18|Inside the Peo 19|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to indicate the input events within the polygon Geo-fence.

menu3.RangeMx: Outside the Peo 0|Outside the Peo 1|Outside the Peo 2|Outside the Peo 3|Outside the Peo 4|Outside the Peo 5|Outside the Peo 6|Outside the Peo 7|Outside the Peo 8|Outside the Peo 9|Outside the Peo 10|Outside the Peo 11|Outside the Peo 12|Outside the Peo 13|Outside the Peo 14|Outside the Peo 15|Outside the Peo 16|Outside the Peo 17|Outside the Peo 18|Outside the Peo 19|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to indicate the input events outside the polygon Geo-fence.

menu2.name: SLM(Sleep Mode Configuration)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTSLM command is used to define many working modes to suit different working scenario for reducing power consumption. The GNSS will be on when device is waked up.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Sleep Mode|2:Deep Sleep Mode
menu3.Description: A numeral indicates many different device performances when device enters into different mode.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable this function|1: Enable this function|

menu3.Description: A voltage threshold for device enters into sleep.
A voltage threshold for device wakeup.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable this function|1: Enable this function|

menu3.Description: A time interval in minute for device stays in motionless state before enters into sleep.
The duration time to confirm motion event. 0 means device will not wakeup by motion.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable this function|1: Enable this function|

menu3.Description: Used to indicate start time for enters into sleep mode in 24-hour time system.
Used to indicate stop time for enters into sleep mode in 24-hour time system.
The interval for device wakeup from sleep.

menu3.RangeMx: External Power Voltage|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to configure the composition of +RESP:GTSLM message.

menu2.name: ASC (Axis Self-Calibration)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTASC is used to define the condition for calibrating the directions of accelerometer. When the auto self-calibration factors updated, the device will report the event message ASC which includes the calibration result to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable the +RESP:GTASC report|1: Enable the +RESP:GTASC report|
menu3.Description: Enable/disable the +RESP:GTASC report.

menu2.name: BTS (Bluetooth Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTBTS is used to configure Bluetooth settings for the device to report certain events.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: The working mode of Bluetooth on the device.
The name of the device for Bluetooth identification.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Non-discoverable mode|1: General Discoverable After Igintion On|2: General Discoverable After Igintion Off|3: General Discoverable After Power On|
menu3.Description: The mode to configure the Bluetooth to be non-discoverable or discoverable for the period according to <Discoverable Time>.
The time period for the device to remain discoverable.

menu3.RangeMx: Bluetooth Name|Bluetooth MAC Address|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Peer Role|Reserved|Peer Address Type|Peer MAC Address|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to configure the composition of Bluetooth information in report messages.

menu3.RangeMx: for +RESP:GTBCS|for +RESP:GTBDS|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to configure which event report should be sent to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: It defines whether a PIN code for pairing is needed or not.
PIN code for pairing if needed.
Frequency of scanning.
The duration of each scan.

menu2.name: BAS (Bluetooth Accessory)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTBAS is used for the device to scan or connect with Bluetooth accessories in order to obtain data such as humidity, temperature or fuel level. To use this command, the parameter <Mode> in the command AT+GTBTS must be enabled.

menu3.Description: The index of the Bluetooth accessory.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: No Bluetooth accessory|2: Beacon temperature sensor|6: Multi-functional beacon sensor|11: Magnet Bluetooth accessory|12: BLE TPMS sensor|13: Relay Bluetooth accessory
menu3.Description: The type of the Bluetooth accessory which is defined in the <Index>.
The model of the Bluetooth accessory which is defined in <Accessory Type>.
The name of the Bluetooth accessory.
The MAC address of the Bluetooth accessory.

menu3.RangeMx: Accessory Name|Accessory MAC|Accessory Status|Accessory Battery Level|Accessory Temperature|Accessory Humidity|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Tire pressure|Time stamp|Enhanced Temperature|Magnet Data|Accessory Battery Percentage|Relay Data|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to configure the composition of Bluetooth accessary info.
The interval for reading data from the Bluetooth accessory.
It specifies the lower voltage limit.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Report temperature alarm within the temperature range|2: Report temperature alarm outside the temperature range|3: Report temperature alarm only once enters or exits the temperature range|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the temperature alarm.
It specifies the lower temperature limit.
It specifies the upper temperature limit.
If the sensor detects the environment temperature which meets the alarm condition, it will continuously check the temperature.
The device will report temperature alarm every this times of temperature reading.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Report temperature alarm within the temperature range|2: Report temperature alarm outside the temperature range|3: Report temperature alarm only once enters or exits the temperature range|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the temperature alarm.
It specifies the lower temperature limit.
It specifies the upper temperature limit.
If the sensor detects the environment temperature which meets the alarm condition, it will continuously check the temperature.
The device will report temperature alarm every this times of temperature reading.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Report humidity alarm within the humidity range|2: Report humidity alarm outside the humidity range|3: Report humidity alarm only once enters or exits the humidity range|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the humidity alarm.
It specifies the lower humidity limit.
It specifies the upper humidity limit.
If the sensor detects the environment humidity which meets the alarm condition, it will continuously check the humidity.
The device will report Humidity alarm every this times of Humidity reading.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: It configures whether to enable event notification function.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Report tire pressure alarm within the tire pressure range|2: Report tire pressure alarm outside the tire pressure range|3: Report tire pressure alarm only once enters/exits the tire pressure range|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the tire pressure alarm.
The lower tire pressure limit.
The upper tire pressure limit.
If the tire pressure keeps meeting the alarm condition for <Validity> times, the tire pressure alarm will be triggered.
After the <Validity> checking, the device will report tire pressure alarm every <Send Interval> times of tire pressure reading based on reading timer of tire pressure sensor.
If the device does not detect the tire pressure sensor in the <Available Validity Time>, the <Accessory Status> in the message +RESP:GTERI will be 0.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: It configures whether to enable event notification function.
It is the current password for the accessory device.
It is set to change the current password.

menu2.name: BID (Bluetooth Beacon ID)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTBID is used for the device to scan Bluetooth beacon accessories. To use this function, the parameter <Mode> in the command AT+GTBTS must be 1.

menu3.Description: The index of the beacon Bluetooth accessory.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Enable/disable this function.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: WKF300|2: ID ELA|4: WID310|
menu3.Description: The model of the beacon Bluetooth accessory.

menu3.RangeMx: Reserved|Accessory MAC|Reserved|Accessory Battery Level|Reserved|Reserved|Signal Strength|Beacon Type and Beacon Data|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to configure the composition of Bluetooth accessory information in messages +RESP:GTBAA and +RESP:GTBID.
It specifies the lower voltage limit. When the voltage of the Bluetooth accessory is below this value, the device will report the message +RESP:GTBAA to the backend server.
The index range of the MAC list to which the MAC addresses are to be updated.
The index range of the MAC list to which the MAC addresses are to be updated.
A list of comma-separated MAC addresses to be updated to the MAC list.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:No push the WKF300|1:Push the WKF300|
menu3.Description: If this parameter is set to 1 and the button on WKF300 is pushed, the device will report the message +RESP:GTBAA to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Allow the device to scan only once|2: After entering ignition on and moving state, the device will keep scanning Keyfobs continuously|4: Allow the device to scan continuously
menu3.Description: It specifies the mode of detecting Keyfob.
The device scans Keyfobs for the time period specified by this parameter.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable alarm|1: Alarm when receiving Bluetooth broadcast|2: Alarm when Bluetooth broadcast is not received|3: Alarm when receiving Bluetooth broadcast or leaving Bluetooth broadcast|
menu3.Description: It specifies the mode of detecting ID ELA.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Allow the device to scan only once|2: After entering ignition on and moving state, the device will keep scanning IDELA continuously|3: Allow the device to scan continuously|
menu3.Description: It specifies the mode of detecting ID ELA.
The device scans IDELA for the time period specified by this parameter.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|2: After entering ignition-on-and-moving state, the device will keep scanning WID310 continuously|3: Allow the device to scan continuously|
menu3.Description: The parameter which specifies the mode of detecting WID310.
The device scans WID310 for the time period specified by this parameter when <WID310 Detection Mode> is 2.
The time interval for sending +RESP:GTBID messages when the engine is on and <WID310 Detection Mode> is 3.
The time interval for sending +RESP:GTBID messages when the engine is off and <WID310 Detection Mode> is 3.
It is the first three bytes of Bluetooth address, which is composed of NAP and UAP.

menu2.name: FRI (Fixed Report Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTFRI is used to configure the parameters for fixed report FRI or ERI.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Fixed Time Report|2: Fixed Distance Report|3: Fixed Mileage Report|4: Optimum Report|5: Fixed Time or Mileage Report|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the fixed report function.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Enable report.|1:Disable report.

menu3.Description: The start time of scheduled report.
The end time of scheduled report.
The time interval for updating GNSS position.
The time interval for sending position information.
The specified distance for sending the position information when <Mode> is 2. Unit: meter.
The specified length for sending the position information when <Mode> is 3 and 4. Unit: meter.
The threshold to determine whether the device is turning around a corner.

menu3.RangeMx: Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Bluetooth Accessory Data|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|RAT and Band Data|
menu3.Description: If the device is connected with a peripheral, and the corresponding bit for the peripheral is set to 1, the device will report +RESP:GTERI instead of +RESP:GTFRI.

After the ignition is turned off, the +RESP:GTFRI/+RESP:GTERI message will continue to be reported according to <Send Interval> for an extra period of time specified by Continue Time>, and then will be reported according to <IGF Report Interval>.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Do not wrap corner point|1: Wrap corner point and wait|
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate whether to wrap corner point together with other fixed GNSS points and wait until the condition to send +RESP:GTFRI or +RESP:GTERI is reached according to the setting of <Mode>.

menu2.name: FFC (Frequency Change of FRI)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTFFC is used to change the parameters of fixed report when a certain event occurs, so that different report interval requirements can be met. When the event disappears, the device will resume its previous settings.

menu3.Description: The priority of the event which triggers the parameter change for fixed report. 0 indicates the highest priority.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Change FRI parameters By Geo-Fence Alarm|2: Change FRI parameters By Know Roaming Alarm|3: Change FRI parameters By Unknow Roaming Alarm|
menu3.Description: It specifies the trigger event for the change of fixed report parameters.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Disable|1: Fixed Time Report|2: Fixed Distance Report|3: Fixed Mileage Report|4: Optimum Report|5: Fixed Time or Mileage Report|
menu3.Description: When a corresponding event occurs, the working mode of the fixed report will be changed according to this parameter.
The time interval for sending the position information when the ignition is on.
The specified distance for sending the position information when the working mode is fixed distance report. Unit: meter.
The specified path length for sending the position information when the working mode is fixed mileage report or optimum report. Unit: meter.
The time interval for GNSS fix.
The threshold to determine whether the device is turning around a corner.

menu2.name: EMG(Emergency Report Mode)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTEMG is used to initiate emergency mode for a predefined time period when the device receives the command via GPRS or SMS, the device will change the location sending interval of fixed time report during the emergency period. When the emergency period is over, the device will switch to original location sending interval automatically. In emergency mode, the value of report ID is 6 in fixed time report message +RESP:GTFRI. This function only works when <Mode> in AT+GTFRI is 1 and 5.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable the current emergency mode if it is in emergency mode now|1: Initiate emergency mode immediately|2: Do not initiate emergency mode, just update configuration
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate the mode for the command.
The period of time the emergency mode works since it is initiated.
The time interval for sending the fixed time report +RESP:GTFRI in the emergency mode. Unit: second.

menu2.name: CRA (Crash Detection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTCRA is used to configure the parameters for crash detection.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable Detection Of Crash With Three-Axis|2: Enable Detection Of Crash With Self-calibration Three-Axis|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the crash detection function.
The acceleration threshold for crash in X direction.
The acceleration threshold for crash in Y direction.
The acceleration threshold for crash in Z direction.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Start Sampling After power on|1: Start Sampling After ignition on|
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate the time when to start acceleration sampling.
The number of recorded XYZ-axis acceleration samples before crash.
The number of recorded XYZ-axis acceleration samples after crash.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Enable.|
menu3.Description: A numeral which indicates whether to report the GNSS information of <GNSS Time Before Crash> seconds before/after crash to the backend server.
The time during which GNSS information is recorded before crash.
The time during which GNSS information is recorded after crash.

menu2.name: DUC (Data Usage Consumption)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTDUC is used to get statistics about data usage.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Normal Mode|2: Random Time Mode at 0 o'clock of the day
menu3.Description: The working mode of this function.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Month|1: Year|
menu3.Description: The unit of statistics period.
The maximum data usage allowed in the <Stat Period>.
The interval for the report +RESP:GTDUC. If it is set to 0, this function will be disabled.
The +RESP:GTDUC will be reported when the total data usage reaches the level specified by this parameter.
The +RESP:GTDUC will be reported when the daily data usage reaches the level specified by this parameter.
Only valid in Mode 2, the random time before sending +RESP:GTDUC when <Report Interval> is enabled.

menu2.name: GEO (Geo-Fence)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTGEO is used to configure the parameters of circular Geo-Fence. Circular Geo-Fence is a virtual perimeter around a geographic area using a location-based service. When the geo fencing terminal enters or exits the area, a notification is generated. .

menu3.Description: The ID of the Geo-Fence. A total of 20 zones (0 - 19) are supported.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Entering the zone|2: Exiting the zone|3: Both entering and exiting|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the device reporting the Geo-Fence message +RESP:GTGIN or +RESP:GTGOT to the backend server.
The longitude of a point which is defined as the center of the circular Geo-Fence zone.
The latitude of a point which is defined as the centre of the circular Geo-Fence zone.
The radius of the circular Geo-Fence zone.
The interval of GNSS checking position information against Geo-Fence alarm.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|21: Auto Mode|22: Manual Mode|
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate the working mode of the geo-fencing function.
Whether to report the message +RESP:GTGES when a specified trigger mode is triggered and when the Geo-Fence is cancelled.
The time to start monitoring the device when it enters the Geo-Fence or departs from the Geo-Fence.
The time to end monitoring the device when it enters the Geo-Fence or departs from the Geo-Fence.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Ignore State Change|1: Need State Change|
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate the mode of reporting GEO state.

menu2.name: PEO (Polygon Geo-Fence)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTPEO is used to configure the parameters of Polygon Geo-Fence. Geo-Fence is a virtual perimeter around a geographic area using a location-based service. When the geo-fencing terminal enters or exits the area, a notification is generated.

menu3.Description: The ID of the Geo-Fence. A total of 20 zones (0 to 19) are supported.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Entering the zone|2: Exiting the zone|3: Both entering and exiting|
menu3.Description: The working mode for the polygon Geo-Fence to report the message to the backend server.
The start point of the polygon GEO-Fence formed by a set of points.
The end point of the polygon GEO-Fence formed by a set of points.
The longitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence zone.
The latitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence zone.
The longitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence zone.
The latitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence zone.
The longitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence zone.
The latitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence zone.
The longitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence zone.
The latitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence zone.
The longitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence zone.
The latitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence zone.
The longitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence zone.
The latitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence zone.
The longitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence zone.
The latitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence zone.
The longitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence zone.
The latitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence zone.
The longitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence zone.
The latitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence zone.
The longitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence zone.
The latitude of a point which is defined as the endpoint of the polygon Geo-Fence zone.
The interval of GNSS checking position information against the polygon Geo-Fence alarm.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Report when getting the PEO state for the first time|1: Do not report until the PEO state changes
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate the mode of reporting PEO state.

menu2.name: HBM (Harsh Behavior Monitoring)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTHBM is used to monitor the harsh driving behavior based on GNSS or motion sensor.The same harsh behavior within 30 seconds will only be reported once if only GNSS is used to measure harsh driving behavior.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Detected by GNSS only|5: Detected by XYZ-axis acceleration data only|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the harsh behavior monitoring function.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Not Discard Unknow Alarm|1: Discard Unknow Alarm|
menu3.Description: It configures whether to discard the +RESP:GTHBM message that indicates unknown harsh behavior.
If the last known speed of the device read from GNSS is greater than or equal to <High Speed>, the vehicle that the device is attached to is considered to be at high speed.
The threshold for harsh braking at high speed level.
The threshold for harsh acceleration at high speed level.
If the last known speed is less than <High Speed> and greater than or equal to <Medium Speed>, the vehicle is considered to be at medium speed.
The threshold for harsh braking at medium speed level.
The threshold for harsh acceleration at medium speed level.
The threshold for harsh braking at low speed level.
The threshold for harsh acceleration at low speed level.
The threshold for the motion sensor to measure whether the device is in harsh cornering or harsh braking state.
The time parameter to measure whether the device enters harsh cornering or harsh braking status.
The threshold for the motion sensor to measure whether the device is in harsh acceleration state.
The time parameter to measure whether the device enters harsh acceleration status.
The threshold for the 3-axial acceleration data measure whether the device is in harsh braking status.
The time parameter to measure whether the device enters harsh braking status.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Only Report HBM Alarm|1: Report HBE and HBM Alarm|2: Only Report HBE Alarm|
menu3.Description: Whether report +RESP:GTHBM and +RESP:GTHBE to the backend server.

menu2.name: IDL (Excessive Idling Detection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTIDL is used to detect the engine excessive idling (vehicle stays stationary while ignition is on). To use this command, the ignition signal must be connected to the device. If the vehicle is entering into/leaves the idle status, the device will report the event message IDN/IDF to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the excessive idling detection function.
If it is detected that the vehicle is stationary with ignition on for the length of time specified by this parameter, it is considered to be in idling state.
If the vehicle moves again and the moving state is maintained for the length of time specified by this parameter after the vehicle enters into idling status, it is considered to leave idling status.
If the vehicle moves a longer distance than <Debounce Distance> after it enters into idling status, the vehicle will be considered to leave idling status.

menu2.name: JDC (Jamming Detection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTJDC is used to configure the parameters for jamming detection. When the detection condition is matched, the device will report the event message JDR/JDS to the backend server according to the <Mode> setting.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Report +RESP:GTJDR upon entering into jamming state|2: Report +RESP:GTJDS upon entering into jamming state or quitting jamming state|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the jamming detection function.
The built-in LTE jamming detection algorithm uses these two parameters to measure whether the device is currently being jammed.
The built-in LTE jamming detection algorithm uses these two parameters to measure whether the device is currently being jammed.
The built-in 2G jamming detection algorithm uses these two parameters to measure whether the device is currently being jammed.
The built-in 2G jamming detection algorithm uses these two parameters to measure whether the device is currently being jammed.
When the device detects jamming, the device will trigger the “enter jamming” event based on <Enter Jamming Timer Threshold> parameter.
When the device quits jamming, the device will trigger the “quit jamming” event based on <Quit Jamming Timer Threshold> parameter.

menu2.name: RMD (Roaming Detection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTRMD is used to configure the parameters for roaming detection.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the roaming detection function.
The index range of the white list from which code are to be updated.
The index range of the white list to which code are to be updated.
A white list of PLMN operator numbers.
The index range of the white list from which code are to be updated.
The index range of the white list to which code are to be updated.
It is mostly like the <Home Operator List>, and the difference is that the operators in this list will be considered as in “Known Roaming” state.
he index range of the list from which code are to be updated.
The index range of the list to which code are to be updated.
It is mostly like the <Home Operator List>, and the difference is that the operators in this list will be considered as in “Blocking Report” state.
Bitwise mask to configure which event message should be sent in known roaming status.
Bitwise mask to configure which event message should be sent in unknown roaming status.

menu2.name: SPD (Speed Alarm)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to set a speed range for the speed alarm function of the terminal. According to the working mode, the terminal could report the message SPD to the backend server when its moving speed is outside or inside the range.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Alarm in speed range|2: Alarm out of speed range|3: Report Speed Alarm Only once|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the speed alarm function.
The lower speed limit.
The upper speed limit.
If the speed meets the alarm condition and is maintained for the period of time specified by <Validity>, the speed alarm will be triggered.
The time interval for sending speed alarm message.
It indicates the type of speed alarm.

menu2.name: SSR (Start/Stop Report)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTSSR is used to detect the status of vehicle (Start/Stop status). When it is detected by the device that the vehicle is entering into Start/Stop status, the device will report the event message STR/STP to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable
menu3.Description: The working mode of the Start/Stop report function.
If the vehicle becomes stationary again and stays in that status for the period of time specified by this parameter after it enters into start status, the vehicle is considered to quit start status.
If it is detected that the vehicle is moving with ignition on for the period of time specified by this parameter, it is considered to be in Start status.
The start speed threshold to determine whether the vehicle is started.
After the vehicle enters into Stop status and stays in the Stop status for the length of time specified by this parameter, the message +RESP:GTLSP will be sent.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Minute|1: Second|
menu3.Description: It controls the time unit of <Time to Stop> and <Time to Start> parameters.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The event message +RESP:GTSTP will be reported when the engine is turned off and the time meets the parameter <Time to Stop>|1: The event message +RESP:GTSTP will be reported immediately when the engine is turned off, it only works when <Mode> is set to 1

menu2.name: Tow (Tow Alarm)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTTOW command is used to configure the tow alarm parameters.

menu3.Description: Enable/disable the tow alarm function.
A time parameter to determine whether the device is considered to be towed after the engine is turned off.
If the motion sensor detects movement after detecting engine off and rest, the device turns into a state called fake tow.
The time interval for sending the tow alarm message.
A time parameter to measure whether the device enters into stationary state.
A time parameter to measure whether the device enters into moving state.
The threshold for the motion sensor to measure whether the device is moving.
A distance parameter to determine whether the device is considered to be towed after the engine is turned off.

menu2.name: EPS (External Power Monitoring)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTEPS is used to configure the parameters for external power supply monitoring. The device will measure and monitor the voltage of the external power supply. If the voltage of the external power supply meets the predefined alarm condition, the device will report an alarm message EPS to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable |1: Report when the input voltage in the range|2: Report when the input voltage outside the range|
menu3.Description: The working mode of the external power supply monitoring function.
The lower limit to the voltage of the external power supply to trigger the alarm.
The upper limit to the voltage of the external power supply to trigger the alarm.
The period for sampling the external power supply.
The time for debouncing external power voltage to avoid excessive voltage drop in the external power supply.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Do not report external power supply voltage|1: Report external power supply voltage|
menu3.Description: Besides the +RESP:GTEPS alarm report, the device can also send the voltage of external power supply periodically along with the fixed report message.
This parameter is used together with <Min Threshold> and <Max Threshold> parameters.
This parameter is used together with <Debounce Time>.
The validity time for detecting whether the device connects or disconnects the main power supply.

menu2.name: DAT (Transparent Data)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTDAT is used to transfer data between the backend server and the accessories connected to the second serial port of the device.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Short Format|2: Long Format|4: Send data directly to the Bluetooth|5: Send data directly to the Bluetooth without CRLF|
menu3.Description: The command type which indicates how to send the data.
Data to be transferred between the backend server and the external device connected to the Bluetooth of the device.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: Need to report +ACK:GTDAT or not.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: ASCII|1:HEX|

menu2.name: UDT (User-defined Data Transfer)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTUDT is used to transfer data to the destination specified by <Mode>. Data to the destination is wrapped into the message UDT(ASCII) and sent to the destination.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable the data transfer|2: Enable data transmission over Bluetooth|
menu3.Description: Enable/disable user-defined data transmission.
The time interval for sending related information when the ignition is on.
Whether to send the related information when the ignition is off.
Bitwise mask to configure the events triggered for which +RESP:GTUDT will be sent to the destination specified by <Mode>.

menu3.RangeMx: Protocol Version, Firmware Version|Hardware Version|Unique ID|Device Name|Speed|Azimuth|Altitude|MCC, MNC, LAC, Cell ID, Position Append Mask|Mileage|HMC|GSV|GEO State|Reserved|Motion Status|External Power VCC, Backup Battery Level, Charging|GEO Status Mask|PEO State|PEO Status Mask|Reserved|Send Time|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to configure which information should be sent to the destination specified by <Mode>.

menu2.name: FVR (Configuration File Version Record)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTFVR is used to record information of the configuration file generated by Manage Tool for AT+GTUPC.

menu3.Description: The name of the configuration file.
The version number of the configuration file.
The parameter is used to confirm the validity of subsequent commands.
The time when the configuration file is generated.

menu2.name: UPC (Update Configuration)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTUPC command is used to download configuration file over the air for the update of the local configuration.

menu3.Description: It specifies the maximum number of retries to download the configuration file upon download failure.
It specifies the expiration timeout of a single download. If the download expires, it is considered to be failure.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: HTTP|
menu3.Description: The protocol used to download the file. Only HTTP is supported now. It is set to 0.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: A numeral which indicates whether to report the message +RESP:GTUPC or +RESP:GTEUC when the configuration is updated over the air.
The time interval measured in hours for updating the configuration over the air.
It specifies the URL to download the configuration file.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: A numeral which indicates the working mode of downloading configuration over the air.
A numeral to indicate the message to be reported for the configuration update status when <Enable Report> is 1.
A numeral to identify the configuration update request.

menu3.RangeMx: Ignition Off|Ignition On|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to configure the status in which the device can update the configuration.

menu2.name: UPD(Firmware Update)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTUPD is used to start and stop the firmware update remotely.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Start the Firmware Update|1:Stop the Firmware Update|
0: HTTP.|
0: BB firmware update.|4: BLE firmware update.
0:Report the +RESP:GTUPD message to indicate the firmware update status.|1:Report the +RESP:GTEUD message to indicate the firmware update status.|

menu2.name: RTO (Real Time Operation)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTRTO is used to retrieve information from the terminal or control the terminal when it executes certain actions.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:GNSS. Get the GNSS related information via the message +RESP:GTGPS|1:RTL. Request the terminal to report its current position immediately via the message +RESP: GTRTL|2:READ. Get the current configuration of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTALM|3:REBOOT. Reboot the terminal|4:RESET. Reset all parameters to factory settings|5:PWROFF. Power off the device|6:CID. Get the ICCID of the SIM card which is being used by the terminal via the message +RESP:GTCID|7:CSQ. Get the current GSM signal level of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTCSQ|8:VER. Get the version information of the device via the message +RESP:GTVER|9:BAT. Get the battery level and adapter status of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTBAT|B: TMZ. Get the time zone settings via the message +RESP:GTTMZ|C:GIR. Get cell information via the message +RESP:GTGSM|D: AIF. Get APN, ICCID, base station ID, RSSI, cell ID, IP and DNS server via the message +RESP:GTAIF|E:GSV. Request the device to report the GNSS satellites information via the message +RESP:GTGSV|14: BLE. Commands for Bluetooth.|1C:ATI. Get basic device information via the message +RESP:GTATI|25:SCS. Get the self-calibration status of the acceleration data via the message +RESP:GTSCS or clear the self-calibration status|31:DELBUF. Delete all the buffered reports|38:DUC. Get the statistics of data usage via the message +RESP:GTDUC|3A:RLY. Set the state of the WRL300|
menu3.Description: A string which indicates the sub command of AT+GTRTO.

menu3.groupname: 0 - GNSS. Get the GNSS related information via the message +RESP:GTGPS

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: 1 - RTL. Request the terminal to report its current position immediately via the message +RESP:GTRTL

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: 2 - READ. Get the current configuration of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTALM
menu3.Description: To get AT command configuration when <Sub Command> is set to 2.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Do not add cutoff characters to the message +RESP:GTALM.|1:Add cutoff characters to the message +RESP:GTALM.|
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate the format of the +RESP:GTALM message.

menu3.groupname: 4 - RESET. Reset all parameters to factory setting
menu3.Description: To reset AT command configuration when <Sub Command> is set to 4.

menu3.groupname: 6 -CID. Get the ICCID of the SIM card which is being used by the terminal via the message +RESP:GTCID.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: 7 - CSQ. Get the current GSM signal level of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTCSQ.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: 8 - VER. Get the version information of the device via the message +RESP:GTVER.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: 9 - BAT. Get the battery level and adapter status of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTBAT.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: B - TMZ. Get the time zone settings via the message +RESP:GTTMZ.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: C - GIR. Get cell information via the message +RESP:GTGSM.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: D - AIF. Get APN, ICCID, base station ID, RSSI, cell ID, IP and DNS server via the message +RESP:GTAIF.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: E - GSV/BSV/RSV/ASV. Request the device to report the GNSS satellites information via the message GSV(ASCII)/(HEX)/RSV(ASCII)/(HEX)/BSV(ASCII)/(HEX)/ASV(ASCII)/(HEX).
menu3.Description: If <Sub Command> is set to E, please get the satellite information message according to the following bitwise mask.
It specifies the Bluetooth command to be executed when <Sub Command> is set to 14.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: 1C - ATI. Get basic device information via the message +RESP:GTATI.
menu3.RangeMx: Firmware Version|Reserved for SW|Reserved for SW|Reserved for SW|BT Firmware Version|BT Boot Firmware Version|Reserved for SW|Reserved for SW|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved for MCU|Reserved for MCU|Hardware Version|Reserved for HW|Reserved for HW|Reserved for HW|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Sensor ID|Modem IMEI|
menu3.Description: If <Sub Command> is set to 1C, the basic information will be reported via the message +RESP:GTATI according to chosen <ATI Mask>.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: 25 - SCS. Get the self-calibration status of the acceleration data via the message +RESP:GTSCS or clear the self-calibration status
menu3.RangeMx: 0: Read self-calibration status|1: Clear self-calibration status|
menu3.Description: If <Sub Command> is set to 25, Read or Clear action is controlled by this parameter.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: 31- DELBUF. Delete all the buffered reports.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Backend Server.|1: Main Serial Port|3: SMS number Or Backend Server|
menu3.Description: This parameter determines the destination that the response message of the RTO command will be reported to. It is invalid for <Sub Command> 2(READ), 3(REBOOT), 4(RESET), and 5(PWROFF).

menu3.groupname: 38 – DUC. Get the statistics of data usage via the message +RESP:GTDUC.
3A - RLY. Set the state of the WRL300.
menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable relay of WRL300|1: Enable relay of WRL300|
menu3.Description: If the sub command is 3A, this parameter will work as follows.
It is used to bind the specific configuration in AT+GTBAS when the <Sub Command> is set to 3A.

menu2.name: RTP (Remote File Transfer)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTRTP is used to obtain files from the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Download File|
menu3.Description: Set the working mode of file transfer.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: HTTP|
menu3.Description: The type of communication protocol used to obtain data from the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: CA certificate.|1: Client Certificate|2: Client key|
menu3.Description: It defines the type of file to download from the server.
It specifies the URL to download the configuration file.

menu2.name: LTP (Local File Transfer)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTLTP is used to write the file to the device by subcontracting.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Delete File|1:Import File|
menu3.Description: Set the working mode of the file.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: CA certificate|1: Client Certificate|2: Client key|
menu3.Description: It defines the type of file to download from the server.
The location where the current data is written to the file.
Total serial number of write file data.
Data written to file.
CRC verification data of <Data> is used to determine whether the data is correct.
